item.title: Eric add a quote by Harry Crews
item.description: "I think all of us are looking for that which does not admit of bullshit . . . If you tell me you can bench press 450, hell, we'll load up the bar and put you under it. Either you can do it or you can't do itâ€”you can't bullshit. Ultimately, sports are just about as close to what one would call the truth as it is possible to get in this world." -- Harry Crews

item.title: Eric add a quote by Sam Harris
item.description: "The president of the United States has claimed, on more than one occasion, to be in dialogue with God. If he said that he was talking to God through his hairdryer, this would precipitate a national emergency. I fail to see how the addition of a hairdryer makes the claim more ridiculous or offensive." -- Sam Harris

item.title: Eric add a quote by Barry Hannah
item.description: "You've got to lie to stay halfway interested in yourself." -- Barry Hannah

item.title: Eric add a quote by Barry Hannah
item.description: "What a bog and labyrinth the human essence is... We are all overbrained and overemotioned." -- Barry Hannah

item.title: Eric add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Eric add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Eric add a quote by Charles Schultz
item.description: "<b>I</b> love mankind ... it's <b>people</b> I can't stand!!" -- Charles Schultz

item.title: Eric add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I'm not afraid of death; I just don't want to be there when it happens." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Eric add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description: "Why do humans exist? A major part of the answer: because Pikaia Gracilens survived the Burgess decimation." -- Christopher Hitchens

item.title: Eric add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "We are going to die, and that makes us the lucky ones. Most people are never going to die because they are never going to be born. The potential people who could have been here in my place but who will in fact never see the light of day outnumber the sand grains of Arabia. Certainly those unborn ghosts include greater poets than Keats, scientists greater than Newton. We know this because the set of possible people allowed by our DNA so massively exceeds the set of actual people. In the teeth of these stupefying odds it is you and I, in our ordinariness, that are here.We privileged few, who won the lottery of birth against all odds, how dare we whine at our inevitable return to that prior state from which the vast majority have never stirred?" -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Eric add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "Never be afraid to raise your voice for honesty and truth and compassion against injustice and lying and greed. If people all over the world...would do this, it would change the earth." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Eric add a quote by Sam Harris
item.description: "I know of no society in human history that ever suffered because its people became too desirous of evidence in support of their core beliefs." -- Sam Harris

item.title: Eric add a quote by Sam Harris
item.description: "The moral truth here is obvious: anyone who feels that the interests of a blastocyst just might supersede the interests of a child with a spinal cord injury has had his moral sense blinded by religious metaphysics." -- Sam Harris

item.title: Eric add a quote by Sam Harris
item.description: "Religious moderation is the direct result of taking scripture less and less seriously. So why not take it less seriously still? Why not admit the the Bible is merely a collection of imperfect books written by highly fallible human beings." -- Sam Harris

item.title: Eric add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "There may be times when we are powerless to prevent injustice, but there must never be a time when we fail to protest." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Eric add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "We must always take sides. Neutrality helps the oppressor, never the victim. Silence encourages the tormentor, never the tormented." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Eric add a quote by Sherman Alexie
item.description: "Do you know why the Indian rain dances always worked? Because the Indians would keep dancing until it rained." -- Sherman Alexie

item.title: Eric add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "Total non-retention has kept my education from being a burden to me." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Eric add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I do not fear death. I had been dead for billions and billions of years before I was born, and had not suffered the slightest inconvenience from it." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Eric add a quote by Ronald P. Carver
item.description: "I believe that the universe was formed around 15 billion years ago and that humans have evolved from their apelike ancestors over the past few million years. I believe we are more likely to live a good life if all humans try to work together in a world community, preserving planet earth. When decisions for groups are made in this world, I believe that the democratic process should be used. To protect the individual, I believe in freedom of speech, freedom of the press, freedom of religion, freedom from religion, freedom of inquiry, and a wall of separation between church and state. When making decisions about what is right or wrong, I believe I should use my intelligence to reason about the likely consequences of my actions. I believe that I should try to increase the happiness of everyone by caring for other people and finding ways to cooperate. Never should my actions discriminate against people simply because of their race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, or national origin. I believe that ideas about what is right and wrong will change with education, so I am prepared to continually question ideas using evidence from experience and science. I believe there is no valid evidence to support claims for the existence of supernatural entities and deities. I will use these beliefs to guide my thinking and my actions until I find good reasons for revising them or replacing them with other beliefs that are more valid." -- Ronald P. Carver
